hints.content:
We can think of $\blueD{10} \times \greenD{2}$ as $\blueD{10}$ rows of $\greenD{2}$ circles. How many circles are there?


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: An array of 20 circles arranged in 10 rows of 2 circles each. The rows are labeled 1 through 10. The columns are labeled 1 and 2. Every circle is labeled with a number. The circles in the first row are labeled 1 and 2. The circles in the second row are labeled 3 and 4. The circles in the third row are labeled 5 and 6. The circles in the fourth row are labeled 7 and 8. The circles in the fifth row are labeled 9 and 10. The circles in the sixth row are labeled 11 and 12. The circles in the seventh row are labeled 13 and 14. The circles in the eighth row are labeled 15 and 16. The circles in the ninth row are labeled 17 and 18. The circles in the tenth row are labeled 19 and 20. !
